prompt:
Create 4 prompts for a cohesive, chronologically flowing thank-you greeting card that tells a visual story (9:16 ratio):

üé® CREATIVITY MANDATE: Be genuinely creative, unique, and innovative! Avoid generic or clich√© designs. Think outside the box, surprise with unexpected elements, use bold artistic choices, and create something truly memorable and special. Push creative boundaries while staying appropriate for the card type and tone.

Theme: "Thank you for attending, thank you for helping prosper thought. include a nice quote in left interior. front Cover:  include John Gilbert clearly and mention ‚ÄúAI For Good June 2025‚Äù. make the artwork in general beautiful but also appropriately professional. Include a nice tree in front cover. don‚Äôt draw any people "
Style: üé® Watercolor
Tone: üåü Inspirational - motivating and uplifting
To: John Gilbert
From: Vibecarding.com Team
Message: "John,

Thank you for being a part of AI for Good this year. Your presence and insightful contributions truly helped to elevate the conversation and inspire new ways of thinking. We are so grateful for minds like yours that are actively shaping a brighter, more thoughtful future for everyone.

With sincere appreciation,
The Vibecarding.com Team"



CRITICAL: Create a cohesive visual narrative that flows chronologically through the card experience:
1. FRONT COVER: First impression - sets the scene/introduces the story
2. INTERIOR SPREAD: The heart of the experience - continuation and climax of the visual story
3. BACK COVER: Conclusion - peaceful resolution or complementary ending

Requirements:
- Flat 2D artwork for printing (not 3D card images)
- Full-bleed backgrounds extending to edges
- IMPORTANT: Keep text, faces, and key elements at least 10% away from top/bottom edges (small amount may be cropped in printing)
- Keep text/faces 0.5" from left/right edges for safe printing
- CONSISTENT visual elements throughout: same characters, color palette, lighting, art style
- Progressive visual storytelling from front ‚Üí interior ‚Üí back
- Put any text in quotes and make it clear/readable
- Each section should feel like part of the same artistic universe
- TONE: Ensure the visual mood and atmosphere matches the motivating and uplifting tone throughout all sections
- INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY SAFETY: If the user mentions specific characters, brands, logos, or products, automatically replace them with original generic alternatives in your prompts. For example: replace specific character names with "cartoon mouse character" or "superhero character", replace brand names with "colorful cereal" or "sports car", etc. Create inspired-by designs that capture the essence without referencing any protected names or specific copyrighted elements. Never include actual brand names, character names, or trademarked terms in the image generation prompts
- CONTENT SAFETY: Ensure all prompts are family-friendly and appropriate for greeting cards. Avoid any content that could be flagged by safety systems including: violence, weapons, inappropriate imagery, political content, controversial topics, scary or disturbing elements, or anything not suitable for all ages. If the user requests something potentially inappropriate, redirect to positive, wholesome alternatives that capture their intent in a family-friendly way








Create prompts that flow chronologically:

1. Front Cover (Opening Scene): BE GENUINELY CREATIVE AND UNIQUE! Include "thank-you" greeting text positioned safely in the center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image). TEXT STYLE: Write the greeting text in beautiful, clearly readable handwritten cursive script that matches the elegant style used inside the card - legible, flowing, and graceful with natural character and warmth. Create charming cartoon-style or stylized illustrated figures if people are needed for the theme. This is the story opening - introduce key visual elements (colors, motifs, artistic style) that will continue throughout the other sections. Think of something unexpected, innovative, and memorable that will surprise and delight the recipient. Avoid generic designs! Style: in watercolor painting style, with soft flowing colors, artistic brush strokes, paper texture, and organic paint bleeds

2. Left Interior (Story Development): UNLEASH YOUR CREATIVITY! You have complete creative freedom to design whatever you want for this left interior page! This is your artistic playground - create something genuinely innovative and unexpected that feels right for a thank-you card with motivating and uplifting tone. You can include: scenes, landscapes, objects, patterns, quotes, text, illustrations, realistic art, abstract art, or anything else that inspires you - but NO PEOPLE or characters unless the user specifically mentioned wanting people in their card description. Position any text safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10%). Think of something no one has done before! Surprise us with bold, imaginative, and memorable artistic choices while maintaining visual harmony with the overall card style and tone. Style: in watercolor painting style, with soft flowing colors, artistic brush strokes, paper texture, and organic paint bleeds

3. Right Interior (Story Climax): BE CREATIVE WITH MESSAGE DESIGN! Include message text: "John,

Thank you for being a part of AI for Good this year. Your presence and insightful contributions truly helped to elevate the conversation and inspire new ways of thinking. We are so grateful for minds like yours that are actively shaping a brighter, more thoughtful future for everyone.

With sincere appreciation,
The Vibecarding.com Team" positioned safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image) integrated into beautiful, innovative decorative artwork. HANDWRITING STYLE: Write the message in beautiful, clearly readable handwritten cursive script that feels elegant and personal. The handwriting should be legible, flowing, and have natural character - not overly perfect but graceful and warm. Use a nice pen-style appearance with natural ink flow and slight variations in line weight. Think of sophisticated calligraphy that's still approachable and easy to read. Make the handwriting feel genuine and heartfelt. Think beyond typical florals and patterns - create something unexpected and artistic that perfectly frames the handwritten message - NO PEOPLE or characters. This should feel like the emotional peak of the card experience, harmonizing with the left interior as a cohesive spread. Avoid clich√© designs and create something genuinely special! Use the elegant cursive handwriting style described above. Style: in watercolor painting style, with soft flowing colors, artistic brush strokes, paper texture, and organic paint bleeds

4. Back Cover (Story Resolution): BE SUBTLY CREATIVE! Create a simple yet innovative decorative design that brings peaceful closure to the visual story. Reference subtle elements from the front cover but keep it minimal and serene - NO PEOPLE, just beautiful, unexpected artistic elements that go beyond typical patterns or florals. IMPORTANT: Leave the bottom-right corner area (approximately 1 inch square) completely clear and undecorated - this space is reserved for a QR code. Focus decorative elements toward the center and left side of the design. Think of something quietly beautiful and memorable that complements the overall design while being genuinely unique. This should feel like a peaceful, artistic ending that surprises with its subtle creativity. Style: in watercolor painting style, with soft flowing colors, artistic brush strokes, paper texture, and organic paint bleeds

VISUAL CONTINUITY CHECKLIST:
- Same color palette across all sections
- Consistent lighting/time of day
- Same artistic techniques and brushwork
- Recurring visual motifs or symbols (but make them unique and memorable!)
- Progressive emotional journey from introduction to resolution
- Front cover: stylized cartoon/illustrated characters if people are needed for the theme
- Left interior: CREATIVE FREEDOM but NO PEOPLE unless user specifically requested people in their description
- Right interior: focus on message space with innovative decorative elements (NO PEOPLE)
- Back cover: simple yet creative decorative design without text or people
- Use simplified, friendly, charming character design if including people (front cover only)
- CREATIVITY PRIORITY: Always choose the more innovative, surprising, and memorable option over generic designs

Return JSON:
{
  "frontCover": "detailed prompt with story opening elements",
  "backCover": "detailed prompt with story conclusion elements",
  "leftInterior": "detailed prompt with story development elements",
  "rightInterior": "detailed prompt with story climax elements"
}

IMPORTANT: Create a completely unique and different interpretation for this specific card variant. Use different creative approaches, color schemes, compositions, and artistic elements while maintaining the same core theme and requirements.

generatedPrompts.frontCover:
```json
{
  "frontCover": "Front cover of a greeting card with a watercolor painting style. The artwork features a large, ancient tree with intricate, gnarled roots spreading across the lower portion of the image. The tree's canopy is lush and detailed, with glowing golden leaves and subtle golden light radiating outwards. Above the tree, a complex, luminous geometric mandala-like pattern is rendered in shimmering gold, resembling a network of interconnected knowledge or ideas. The background transitions from a soft, warm, sandy hue near the horizon to a deep, rich, inky blue at the top, speckled with subtle golden dust or stars. The overall mood is inspirational and professional. Positioned at the bottom of the card, centered and safely within the printable area, are the words \"John Gilbert\" in a classic, elegant serif font, followed by \"AI FOR GOOD\" and \"JUNE 2025\" in a slightly smaller, clean sans-serif font.",
  "backCover": "Back cover of a greeting card with a watercolor painting style, continuing the theme from the front cover. The design is minimal and serene, featuring a subtle, abstract representation of radiating light or energy in soft golden hues, reminiscent of the illuminated pattern on the front. This abstract element is positioned towards the center-left of the card, avoiding the bottom-right corner which is left completely clear for a QR code. The background has a soft, muted watercolor wash, transitioning from a warm, pale ochre near the bottom to a slightly cooler, desaturated blue-grey towards the top, creating a sense of peaceful closure. The texture of watercolor paper is visible throughout, with gentle color variations and soft edges.",
  "leftInterior": "Left interior of a greeting card with a watercolor painting style. The artwork depicts a continuation of the 'AI For Good' theme, visually represented by a sprawling, organic network of glowing golden lines and nodes, similar to the geometric pattern on the front cover but more free-flowing and interconnected. This network spreads across the page, intertwining with subtle, soft-focus watercolor washes of warm golds, earthy browns, and muted blues. The overall impression is one of growth, connection, and flourishing ideas, evoking an inspirational and motivating tone. No people or characters are present. The composition should feel artistic and conceptually rich, hinting at the blossoming of thought and progress without being overly literal.",
  "rightInterior": "Right interior of a greeting card with a watercolor painting style. The focal point is the handwritten message, presented in an elegant, flowing cursive script with a natural, ink-like appearance. The text \"John,\n\nThank you for being a part of AI for Good this year. Your presence and insightful contributions truly helped to elevate the conversation and inspire new ways of thinking. We are so grateful for minds like yours that are actively shaping a brighter, more thoughtful future for everyone.\n\nWith sincere appreciation,\nThe Vibecarding.com Team\" is artfully integrated into a decorative composition that echoes the themes from the front cover. Surrounding the text are delicate, abstract wisps of golden light and subtle, organic watercolor textures in warm earth tones and soft blues, creating an inspirational and uplifting atmosphere. The decorative elements are not floral or patterned in a traditional sense, but rather suggest the subtle blossoming of ideas and interconnectedness, complementing the handwritten message without overwhelming it. The entire spread maintains the consistent watercolor style, paper texture, and color palette, with the text safely positioned in the center area."
}
```
generatedPrompts.backCover: Back cover design for a greeting card with a subtle, serene, and artistic resolution to the visual story. The artistic style is a delicate watercolor painting with soft, muted colors and a gentle paper texture. The background is a soft, creamy off-white, with subtle washes of pale blue and grey creating a gentle gradient and a sense of depth, particularly around the lower left quadrant. The main visual element is a single, stylized stem with delicate, fine branches that ascend upwards and towards the right. These branches are depicted in a creamy white, almost luminescent, with tiny, subtle dots of white along their tips, resembling nascent buds or shimmering light particles. The base of this delicate stem emerges from a softly rendered, oval-shaped form in the lower left of the image. This form transitions from a soft, warm golden yellow at its upper part to a muted, dusty blue at its base, with a subtle, diffused shadow beneath it. The overall composition is minimal and elegant, leaving the majority of the space open and airy. The design focuses on the upper left and center-left areas, ensuring the bottom-right corner, approximately 1 inch square, is completely clear and undecorated to accommodate a QR code. There is no text or figurative imagery, maintaining a peaceful and contemplative conclusion that echoes the gentle, organic aesthetic established in earlier parts of the card. The watercolor brushstrokes are visible but soft, contributing to an overall feeling of quiet growth and subtle luminescence, providing a complementary and calming ending.
generatedPrompts.leftInterior: Left interior page of a greeting card with a watercolor painting style. The background is a deep, rich teal blue, blended with lighter washes of turquoise and hints of a soft, pale yellow in the center. Overlaying this watercolor wash is an intricate network of branching, vein-like lines rendered in a luminous, metallic gold. These golden lines spread organically from the center outwards, creating a pattern reminiscent of a tree's root system, a neural network, or the branching veins of a leaf. The texture of the watercolor paper is subtly visible. Centered within this abstract, organic design is the quote: "The mind that opens to a new idea never returns to its original size." The text is presented in a flowing, elegant black cursive script with subtle variations in line weight, giving it a handwritten feel. The composition is balanced, with the text clearly legible against the textured, abstract background, and the golden network of lines subtly framing the words without overpowering them. The overall mood is inspirational, intellectual, and visually captivating, reflecting the theme of expanding thought and new ideas.
generatedPrompts.rightInterior: Right interior page of a thank-you card designed for message space with a delicate watercolor wash background in soft, muted teal and cream tones. A stylized golden tree branch, with subtle shimmering golden speckles emanating from its tips, reaches down from the upper left corner. The main message is presented in an elegant, flowing cursive script in a warm, dark sepia ink. The text is well-spaced and centered, filling the majority of the right side of the card. The handwriting is legible, with a natural, slightly varied line weight, giving it a personal and warm feel. The overall aesthetic is sophisticated and uplifting, with no decorative borders or frames, allowing the natural beauty of the watercolor and the handwritten message to be the primary focus. The composition intentionally leaves ample white space around the text to ensure readability and a sense of calm.
